column4: what about runing windows programs - i would need VB6 access - is that possible?
emulator?
is it fast?
does it require you install windows on the machine too?
i have legit windows yeah
i have windows - but im interested in swapping to linux (poss. ubuntu) but as i have a few long term projects in VB6 i would need to be able to run it in linux
im not complaining - and i dont need to port to another language thank you
is momo and wine free too?
probly a bad idea conding a windows program in linux anyway
can you install windows and linux on the same machine and choose OS on boot up - can that be done?
yes, it's called dual-booting.
is dual booting fast, i imagine i can only have 1 os running at the same time yes?
correct. and yes, it's fast.
sounds more and more tempting
not much to lose in trying it, really.
time, only.
true - so long as i dont have to format my HDD to instal it and it can run beside my current OS
oh and simcity4 i see can be ran in wine
how do i go about it?
does my bios have to support it?
i.e how do i select my OS
a menu appears.
